function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Large gatherings and celebrations may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases due to close contact and crowding.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disputes over space and competition for infrastructure among pedestrians, micro-mobility devices, and motorized vehicles","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global interconnected settlement system","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for urban-scale regulations at a global scale","category":"Security","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rethinking public space design to protect and promote planetary health","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inability to prevent or absorb undesired events","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vague definition of resilience","category":"Resilience","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overlap with existing concepts","category":"Resilience","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of specific examples","category":"Resilience","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of disciplinary-specific approaches to resilience, including in the context of contagious diseases","category":"Resilience","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of resilience dimensions may lead to incomplete mitigation strategies for contagious diseases","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of focus on interdependent network performance","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consensus on resilience definitions leads to ambiguity in understanding resilience concepts.","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unequal distribution of resilience research across different domains may lead to neglect of certain areas of application, including contagious disease resilience.","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Qualitative assessment methods may overlook important numerical metrics that are crucial for understanding the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient consideration of qualitative aspects in quantitative resilience approaches may lead to overlooking the socio-behavioral factors that influence contagious disease spread.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of semi-quantitative indices to assess resilience may lead to oversimplification of complex systems and miss important factors.","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on expert opinion for assessing resilience variables may introduce bias and inaccuracies in the assessment process.","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate resilience measurement due to deterministic static metric.","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"General applicability of the resilience triangle metric may lead to misapplication in different contexts.","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in comprehending the resilience metric","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Linear recovery assumption may not be realistic for some systems and events","category":"Resilience","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ambiguity in defining system states and their corresponding performance metrics.","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ambiguity in notation and terminology","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The text contains multiple references to disruption, non-operability, and recovery, indicating a focus on the impact of contagious diseases on system resilience.","category":"Resilience","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unclear relationship between absorptive capacity and adaptive capacity","category":"Resilience","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Probabilistic approach for assessing resilience","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The text discusses the implications of aging on system performance and resilience, which may be relevant in the context of contagious diseases that affect different age groups differently.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The text mentions the inclusion of contingency strategies in the resilience metric, which may not fully account for the rapid and evolving nature of contagious disease outbreaks.","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on imprecise probabilities for quantifying resilience","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Qualitative assessments of organizational resilience factors may overlook critical quantitative indicators, leading to biased ranking.","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interdependencies among infrastructure systems can impact the resilience of other systems.","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unexplored tradeoffs among the dimensions of resilience","category":"Resilience","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective use of hotlines and sponsored advertisements for disease education","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Challenges in crisis management","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coordination between nurses and doctors","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Qualitative approach leading to potential bias in the study results","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Purposive sampling technique used to select diverse participants may not fully represent the population and lead to biased results.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Absenteeism and presenteeism among nurses","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate coordination of health services resulting in inadequate responses to health emergencies","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exchange of nurses to address shortages","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Psychological problems such as panic, fear, anxiety, and depression among staff nurses","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Global misinformation and the 'infodemic'","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of preparation to deal with psychological problems","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on the psychological well-being of nurses during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of training and education on pandemic preparedness and infection control","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor communication and collaboration between nursing and medical management teams","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of communication and collaboration between nurses and physicians in a civil environment","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Qualitative research may introduce bias due to subjective approach","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited scope of study with focus on nursing managers only","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"}]}
